remarks: A subset of the multiplicative group has the multiplicative identity as its identity if the identity is in the subset.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Dec-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2015.)
statement:
ringidss.g $e |- M = ( ( mulGrp ` R ) |`s A ) $.
ringidss.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
ringidss.u $e |- .1. = ( 1r ` R ) $.
ringidss $p |- ( ( R e. Ring /\ A C_ B /\ .1. e. A ) -> .1. = ( 0g ` M ) ) $.
